title: Pass max_timeout, max_tokens, max_errors to child RLM in _subcall()
description:
Child RLM instances spawned via _subcall() don't inherit the parent's limit parameters.

**Current behavior (rlm/rlm/core/rlm.py ~line 546-561):**
- max_iterations: passed (same value)
- max_depth: passed (same value)  
- max_budget: passed (calculated as remaining budget) âœ“
- max_timeout: NOT passed
- max_tokens: NOT passed
- max_errors: NOT passed

**Problem:**
A child RLM can run indefinitely or consume unlimited tokens if parent has limits but child doesn't inherit them.

**Fix:**
Pass these parameters to child RLM constructor in _subcall():
- max_timeout: remaining time (parent timeout - elapsed)
- max_tokens: same as parent (or remaining if tracked)
- max_errors: same as parent

**Source:** Feedback from RLM depth>1 review
close_reason: Implemented in rlm/rlm/core/rlm.py - child RLM now receives max_timeout (remaining), max_tokens, max_errors, and model= override

title: Wire model= parameter through to child RLM in _subcall()
description:
When REPL code calls llm_query(prompt, model='haiku') and it triggers a recursive RLM (depth < max_depth), the child RLM should use the specified model as its backend, not inherit the parent's default.

**Current behavior:**
- _subcall() accepts model parameter but ignores it
- Comment in code: 'Currently uses the configured backends regardless of this parameter'
- Child always uses parent's configured backends

**Desired behavior:**
- If model= is specified, child RLM uses that model
- Enables cost optimization: root uses opus, subcalls use haiku
- Enables dynamic model selection based on subtask complexity

**Implementation notes:**
- Modify _subcall() in rlm/rlm/core/rlm.py (~line 507)
- Need to pass model to child RLM constructor or configure client
- Consider: should this override default_backend or other_backend_client?

**Source:** Feedback from RLM depth>1 review
close_reason: Implemented in rlm/rlm/core/rlm.py - child RLM now receives max_timeout (remaining), max_tokens, max_errors, and model= override
